thread.title: Thomas' 37 points powers Celtics to OT win over Bucks | NBA | Sporting News
thread.title_full: Thomas' 37 points powers Celtics to OT win over Bucks | NBA | Sporting News

author: Nba Australia
title: Thomas' 37 points powers Celtics to OT win over Bucks | NBA | Sporting News
text:
January 29, 2017 12:15am EST January 28, 2017 11:27pm EST Boston win third straight. NBA Australia 
Published on Jan. 28, 2017 | Updated on Jan. 29, 2017 
Jan. 28, 2017 
Isaiah Thomas poured in 37 points to lead the Boston Celtics to a tight 112-108 win over the Milwaukee Bucks in overtime. 
MORE: Cousins leads Kings to tight win over Hornets 
Thomas has been the Celtics' rock this season down the stretch, but it was Jae Crowder who stepped up late, draining their' final four points at the free-throw line to ice the game. 
Boston scored the first six points in the overtime period and looked to have the game sewn up before Tony Snell drained back-to-back threes to tie things up at 108-108 with 1:13 remaining. 
Thomas added eight assists, connecting on 6-for-11 from the three-point line, while Crowder finished with 20 points and six rebounds. 
Despite being without the injured Al Horford and Avery Bradley, Boston raced out of the gates with a 42-point first quarter and after holding a 64-53 advantage at the main break, the Celtics saw their lead slowly disappear. Milwaukee refused to go away as they steped up their defence, pulling even in the fourth quarter on a Giannia Antetokounmpo three-pointer. 
Greg Monroe then gave them their first lead of the game, converting an and-1. 
Giannis Antetokounmpo led the Bucks with 21 points, while Michael Beasley poured in 17 points and eight rebounds off the bench. The Bucksfinished with six players in double figures. 
The Celtics return home for a four-game homestand, startgin with the Detroit Pistons on Tuesday AEDT.
